page.title: 14TRANSPORT IN EDDERTON
page.content: There are several types of transport in Edderton, the most common being the {motor car.}Mosty every family in Edderton has a car to get to work or for pleasure.Most people consider it essential to have a car in Edderton because it is so remote. Lots of young people and a few adults have{bicycles which are used mainly for leisure and keeping fit.A{railway line}goes through Edderton but the{train}no longer stops here.If you wish to catch the train you have to travel 8km to the nearest railway station in Tain.Three public buses travel north every day except Sunday and three travel south stopping in the village to pick up and drop of fare paying passengers.Because there is an alternative and faster route to the north the main road through Edderton remains fairly quiet.
